result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard K. Fibish II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard K. Fibish II is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard K. Fibish II was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Minutes:  22CF284/22TR1804/1805/1806.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Lehman appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody along w/Atty Eric Olson.  Cases are resolved.  

22CF284 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft fined $500 plus costs.  (1) yr to pay.  Deft may have a payment plan at the rate of $100/mo commencing 9/1/22.  DNA surcharge ordered; sample previously provided.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.    

TR files - all TR files are dismissed on plaintiff's motion.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Richard K. Fibish appeared with Attorney J. Eric Olson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Det Brian Horensky; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Olson. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. DE requests substitution of Br 2; Br 3 assigned.  Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
DE requests substitution of Br 2; Br 3 assigned.
